section.title: Importing a project through the Menu

listitem.para: In the dialog which appears (), enter or browse to the Projects you want to import.
If you have entered the path to a Project, click ”Add” to add it to the list of Projects to be imported.
Note that the ”Add” button will only be activated if the path you have entered is correct.

If you add multiple Projects to be imported, you can change the order they are imported in using the arrows next to the list of Projects. You can also remove a Project from the list of Projects to be imported.
If you are importing Projects that are dependent on other Projects (i.e. they reuse other Projects), import the supporting Projects first.
If you only want to import one Project, you can select the option to open the Project once it has been imported.
When you have finished your selection, click ”OK”. The Projects you selected will be imported in the order specified.

section.title: Importing projects through drag and drop
section.para: Projects can be imported by dragging and dropping their project files to the Test Suite Browser View of the ITE. After dragging the project files to the Browser, a dialog is opened, listing the files to be imported. After confirming, the import is executed, and if only one project is imported this way, it is automatically opened.
Please note, that this operation is not supported by all Linux environments.
